intro: Macaglia megalocarpa, commonly known as the giant seed tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces massive, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and the plant can grow up to 10 meters tall. Due to its size and unique appearance, it is a notable species in the flora of its native region.
